name: Marloss flower
description: This flower is like the other flowers taken by the mushrooms, but its bulb is colored a brilliant cyan color.  It emits an aroma both overwhelming and strangely alluring.

name: fungal flower
description: This flower has been overgrown by gray, sinewy tendrils of fungus, and the color has been leached from its petals and stem.  It gently sways of its own volition, maintaining an unsettling rhythm.

name: fungal mass
description: Thick ropes of Mycal matter have covered the ground here completely.  It's soft to the touch, but not firm enough to hold any weight.

name: fungal clump
description: Alien mold and stems mingle tightly here, swaying around and weaving together, creating a sort of fungal bush.

name: fungal tangle
description: Thick, ropy tendrils of fungus have risen from the ground and gathered into an impenetrable clump.

name: mushroom colony
description: A large pile of organic matter which has molded over with fungus.  The caps of many mushrooms spring from the top, all of which are fortunately terrestrial. You could snip some of the mushrooms from it.

name: mushroom colony
description: A large pile of organic matter which has molded over with fungus.  The caps of many mushrooms spring from the top, all of which are fortunately terrestrial.  Some leftover stumps remain where mushrooms were picked, while others are regrowing.
